---
title: gensx env show
description: Show current GenSX environment details
---

# gensx env show

The `gensx env show` command displays detailed information about the currently selected environment, including its configuration and status.

## Usage

```bash
gensx env show [options]
```

## Options

| Option                  | Description                                                                  |
| ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `-p, --project <name>`  | Project name to show environment details for.                                |
| `-h, --help`            | Display help for the command.                                                |

## Description

This command:

1. Shows detailed information about the currently selected environment
2. Displays environment configuration and settings
3. Provides status information about the environment

The output includes:
- Environment name
- Project name
- Creation date
- Last modified date
- Whether it's the default environment
- Environment variables (if any)
- Associated workflows and their status

## Examples

```bash
# Show details of the current environment
gensx env show

# Show environment details for a specific project
gensx env show --project my-app
```

## Notes

- You must be logged in to GenSX Cloud to show environment details (`gensx login`)
- If no environment is selected, the command will indicate this
- The output format is designed to be both human-readable and machine-parseable
- Environment variables are shown in a secure format (values are masked)
- You can use this command to verify your current environment before running important operations
